channel.name: What does `voting_for` in account update do?

embeds.title: mina/src/lib/mina_wire_types/mina_base/mina_base_account_update.ml ...
embeds.description: Mina is a cryptocurrency protocol with a constant size blockchain, improving scaling while maintaining decentralization and security. - MinaProtocol/mina

messages.content: Best guess : Voting for xyz proposal to be included in the next hardfork
> The previous epoch lock hash of the chain which you are voting for

We don't document the state (and other) fields well enough. I think we should rework the docs to include a in-detail overview of account and account update structures, including detailed explanations and examples. wdyt @45930
@Florian so it’s for voting on hardforks? Is the voting mechanism noted anywhere?

Btw, would it be possible in some future hardfork to amend the AccountUpdates update fields to include not only values that should be set, but abilities to at least increase or decrease the value by x, to be able to implement counters, something like
```
"update":{
"appState":[
  0:{ value: 1, type: "increase by"},
  ...
]
```
or, in ideal case, be able to define some simple programs executed on-chain using current account state taking into account all the tx already included into block being created.. 
For example, it would make implementation of circulatingSupply much simpler in the FungibleToken and the tx verification faster, as we would have several simple add operations instead of one more proof verification and mint operation.
Make a helper account and use balance change
It is how circulatingSupply implemented now, but it is clearly not optimal solution and it invloves minting or burning tokens just to keep simple counter.

- You need only simple counter to keep circulatingSupply. In general case, it would be great to be able to use the value of the counter to set some values (for example, when you mint NFTs, to set the number of NFT or, if you want to process many txs, to write tx info to the token account together with sequence number and later process one by one)
- What we should do now is 
  - Add one more AccountUpdate with proof authorization, increasing the number of weigh units of the tx and increasing the time the tx should be verified. Given current limit of 5 AccountUpdates with proof authorization, we spend one of those 5 for this counter, limiting what we can do in tx
  - mint or burn tokens, making statistics on all explorers incorrect as all explorers now showing the number of tokens double of the real minted.
  - pay 1 MINA just for the creation of the counter, creating the account that we don't actually need and can use one of 8 Fields in FungibleToken account.
  - and we cannot use the value of the counter in our code, as probably it will be different on-chain
The real solution is to make it cheaper than to add another ad hoc solution
I am not too sure about how exactly the hardfork mechanism works, I would have to take look into that

We definitely want to make it easier to deal with temporary accounts, deletion and consumption of them, we call it zkPromise internally. 

We are also looking into improving the account update model, such as allowing account updates to inspect their callers/parents and traverse the rest of the tree. We are also currently extending the account update fields to include more preconditions, I think we are very open to more suggestions in that direction! Happy to consider your idea :)

This is great news; such new features will certainly be important for developers’ experience.  As you're considering now the changes, let me share some ideas that can be considered too:

- Adding maps to the account state. The possibility we have now is to have maps as token accounts. There are many cases when the token functionality is not needed, only the map functionality. So, having the possibility to add the map containing X Fields for each element and do usual map operations (add, delete, update, get) for any account (not only zkApp account) at some cost like 1 MINA per map creation and maybe 0.01 MINA per element addition would benefit many zkApps that will be able to use the values on-chain instead of values off-chain. The reference example is the map in Ethereum.
- Adding the possibility to execute some code on-chain in addition to executing the code off-chain. There can be some weight units assigned to the code execution, and the snark workers can create the proofs of such code execution AFTER the tx was included in the block, thus resolving the concurrency issues for the contracts. It will complement the Actions and Reducer pattern, giving the developer the choice of which pattern to use. In the simplest case, it can be the counters updated on-chain, as discussed above. Reference implementations: [AWS DynamoDB counters](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/database/implement-resource-counters-with-amazon-dynamodb/), [Aleo async functions](https://docs.leo-lang.org/leo/testnetbeta#an-async-programming-model)
- Caller reference (similar to msg.sender in Ethereum) https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1817
- Guaranteed approve() of the AccountUpdate. The idea is to have an AccountUpdate passed as the argument to the SmartContract method, inspected by the method for some values (with the constraints being created in the process), and then some `guaranteedApprove()` being called that locks the AccountUpdate except for signature/proof authorization and attach to this method's AccountUpdate as child update without the possibility to call `unlink()` on it. https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1280767157969358942
- Amending Mina.transaction to include price per weight unit in addition the total fee https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1626
- Increasing or removing the AccountUpdates limit https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/discussions/16041
- Always use `useFullCommitment` (as I understand it is already implemented) https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1798
- Ability to delete accounts that are no longer needed and be reimbursed for 1 MINA creation fee. It will allow the creation of token accounts as temporary storage and then remove them as soon as this temporary on-chain storage is no longer needed.
- Having clear and easy-to-audit interfaces for the creation of AccountUpdates directly (like ZkProcessor) https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1807

Hope some of those ideas will be helpful.
Adding features isn’t always a good thing.
Agree with you, but it is always good to have all the options on the table to evaluate and choose from.
Your input is invaluable! We're actively evaluating several of your ideas. Let's continue our dialogue - I'm confident we'll see exciting enhancements in the coming months
